caller_intent: José wants to update his home and auto insurance policies, clarify coverage for his roof (which he estimates is 10-12 years old), and understand how different deductible options (e.g., $1,000 vs. $2,500) affect his premiums. He also seeks guidance on switching providers without overlapping coverage.
resolution_steps: Agent confirms José's address (104 Miller Street, Mauneri Norte Carolina, 27030) and policy details.
Discusses roof age (2010-2012) and explains how insurers may limit coverage for roofs over 10 years old.
Explains deductible options ($1,000, $2,500, $5,000) and their impact on premiums.
Gathers home details: trampoline (no longer used), heat pump, no swimming pool, and electrical/plumbing ages (estimated 5 years for HVAC, unknown for others).
Notes José's lack of claims history and confirms he has a central alarm system (fire only) and circuit breaker box.
Agrees to process new quotes and confirms José's phone number for follow-up.
knowledge_required: Insurance coverage rules for aging roofs (e.g., 10-year thresholds)
Deductible structures and their effect on premiums
Home inspection requirements for insurance underwriting
Impact of home features (e.g., trampolines, heat pumps) on policy terms
systems_referenced: Internal policy database (to check roof age and claims history)
summary: José is updating his home and auto insurance policies, seeking clarification on roof coverage, deductible options, and cost implications. The agent gathered detailed home information and will process new quotes. José emphasized avoiding overlapping coverage and requested a follow-up call.
